page.title: 02SHREWSBURY'S POLITICAL SCENE
page.content: Shrewsbury's political scene,in 1985, is interesting but confusing.Mr.Derek Conway, the Conservative Member of Parliament,was elected with a majority of over{8,000 votes}in 1983 but had fewer votes than the total cast for his two opponents,the Liberal Alliance candidate,who came second,and the Labour candidate who was bottom of the poll.This brings claims from supporters of the other parties that Mr.Conway is not the choice of the majority of the people he represents. But this is our electoral system-and it does work in reverse elsewhere. Locally the scene is equally confusing.Although the{Conservatives have most members on Shrewsbury and Atcham Borough Council,their number is equalled by{Labour}and{Liberal councillors.Shrewsbury's most famous Member of Parliament was{Disraeli.
